articles.title: Derbyshire GP who helped thousands dies from same disease she treated - BBC.com
articles.description: Dr Louise Jordan dies at home aged 62 after helping thousands with terminal illnesses.
articles.content:
A Derbyshire family doctor who enabled thousands with terminal illnesses to die at home has died from a rare form of motor neurone disease (MND).

articles.title: A common stomach infection can increase the risk of developing Alzheimer's disease, study finds - Euronews
articles.description: While a stomach bug is undoubtedly an unpleasant experience, its symptoms normally disappear in a matter of a few days. But now researchers have found that a stomach bug found in a majority of people can be quite dangerous in the long term.

articles.title: Avoiding COVID-19 was about more than just keeping 2 metres apart, study finds - Euronews
